verse_text: And when they had drawn near to Jerusalem, and had arrived at Bethphage, at the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples
saying to them: â€œGo into the town that is opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her. Release them, and lead them to me
And if anyone will have said anything to you, say that the Lord has need of them. And he will promptly dismiss them.
Now all this was done in order to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet, saying
â€œTell the daughter of Zion: Behold, your king comes to you meekly, sitting on a donkey and on a colt, the son of one accustomed to the yoke.
Then the disciples, going out, did just as Jesus instructed them
And they brought the donkey and the colt, and they laid their garments on them, and they helped him sit upon them
Then a very numerous crowd spread their garments on the way. But others cut branches from the trees and scattered them on the way
And the crowds that preceded him, and those that followed, cried out, saying: â€œHosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord. Hosanna in the highest!
And when he had entered into Jerusalem, the entire city was stirred up, saying, â€œWho is this?
But the people were saying, â€œThis is Jesus, the Prophet from Nazareth of Galilee.
And Jesus entered into the temple of God, and he cast out all who were selling and buying in the temple, and he overturned the tables of the money changers and the chairs of the vendors of doves
And he said to them: â€œIt is written: â€˜My house shall be called a house of prayer. But you have made it into a den of robbers.â€™
And the blind and the lame drew near to him in the temple; and he healed them
Then the leaders of the priests and the scribes became indignant, seeing the miracles that he wrought, and the children crying out in the temple, saying, â€œHosanna to the Son of David!
And they said to him, â€œDo you hear what these ones are saying?â€ But Jesus said to them, â€œCertainly. Have you never read: For out of the mouth of babes and infants, you have perfected praise?
And leaving them behind, he went out, beyond the city, into Bethania, and he lodged here
Then, as he was returning to the city in the morning, he was hungry

And seeing a certain fig tree beside the way, he approached it. And he found nothing on it, except only leaves. And he said to it, â€œMay fruit never spring forth from you, for all time.â€ And immediately the fig tree was dried up
And seeing this, the disciples wondered, saying, â€œHow did it dry up so quickly?

And Jesus responded to them by saying: â€œAmen I say to you, if you have faith and do not hesitate, not only shall you do this, concerning the fig tree, but even if you would say to this mountain, â€˜Take and cast yourself into the sea,â€™ it shall be done
And all things whatsoever that you shall ask for in prayer: believing, you shall receive.

And when he had arrived at the temple, as he was teaching, the leaders of the priests and the elders of the people approached him, saying: â€œBy what authority do you do these things? And who has given this authority to you?
In response, Jesus said to them: â€œI also will question you with one word: if you tell me this, I also will tell you by what authority I do these things
The baptism of John, where was it from? Was it from heaven, or from men?â€ But they thought within themselves, saying
â€œIf we say, â€˜From heaven,â€™ he will say to us, â€˜Then why did you not believe him?â€™ But if we say, â€˜From men,â€™ we have the crowd to fear, for they all hold John to be a prophet.
And so, they answered Jesus by saying, â€œWe do not know.â€ So he also said to them: â€œNeither will I tell you by what authority I do these things
But how does it seem to you? A certain man had two sons. And approaching the first, he said: â€˜Son, go out today to work in my vineyard.
And responding, he said, â€˜I am not willing.â€™ But afterwards, being moved by repentance, he went
And approaching the other, he spoke similarly. And answering, he said, â€˜I am going, lord.â€™ And he did not go

Which of the two did the will of the father?â€ They said to him, â€œThe first.â€ Jesus said to them: â€œAmen I say to you, that tax collectors and prostitutes shall precede you, into the kingdom of God
For John came to you in the way of justice, and you did not believe him. But the tax collectors and the prostitutes believed him. Yet even after seeing this, you did not repent, so as to believe him

Listen to another parable. There was a man, the father of a family, who planted a vineyard, and surrounded it with a hedge, and dug a press in it, and built a tower. And he loaned it out to farmers, and he set out to sojourn abroad
Then, when the time of the fruits drew near, he sent his servants to the farmers, so that they might receive its fruits
And the farmers apprehended his servants; they struck one, and killed another, and stoned yet another
Again, he sent other servants, more than before; and they treated them similarly
Then, at the very end, he sent his son to them, saying: â€˜They will revere my son.
But the farmers, seeing the son, said among themselves: â€˜This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and then we will have his inheritance.
And apprehending him, they cast him outside the vineyard, and they killed him
Therefore, when the lord of the vineyard arrives, what will he do to those farmers?
They said to him, â€œHe will bring those evil men to an evil end, and he will loan out his vineyard to other farmers, who shall repay to him the fruit in its time.
Jesus said to them: â€œHave you never read in the Scriptures: â€˜The stone that the builders have rejected has become the cornerstone. By the Lord has this been done, and it is wonderful in our eyes?
Therefore, I say to you, that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you, and it shall be given to a people who shall produce its fruits
And whoever will have fallen on this stone shall be broken, yet truly, on whomever it shall fall, it will crush him.
And when the leaders of the priests, and the Pharisees had heard his parables, they knew that he was speaking about them
And though they sought to take hold of him, they feared the crowds, because they held him to be a prophet
